Hattie Gossett (amụrụ ya n'abalị iri na otu n'ọnwa Eprel n'afọ 1942) bụ onye na-ede egwuregwu, onye na-agụ abụ, na onye nchịkọta magazin. Ọrụ ya na-elekwasị anya n'ịkwalite ùgwù onwe onye nke ụmụ agbọghọ ojii.

A mụrụ ya na New Jersey, Gossett nwetara nzere Master of Fine Arts na Mahadum New York n'afọ 1993, ebe ọ bụ Yip Harburg Fellow. Ọ bụ David Randolph Distinguished Artist-in-Residence na The New School n'afọ 2001.

Gossett "tinyeere aka na atụmatụ" nke magazin Essence, nke e bipụtara n'afọ 1970, ọ bụkwa onye mbụ sonyere na Kitchen Table: Women of Color Press nke Audre Lorde na Barbara Smith guzobere n'afọ 1980. Gossett bụkwa onye nchịkọta akụkọ na True Story, Redbook, McCall's na magazin ihe nkiri ojii, ma mesịa kụzie ma mee ọmụmụ ihe gbasara edemede, akwụkwọ ojii, na egwu ojii na Mahadum Rutgers, SUNY Empire State College, kọleji nke Oberlin, na ebe ndị ọzọ.
Nchịkọta abụ Gossett bụ Presenting...Nwanne Nwanyị Noblues Firebrand Books bipụtara ya n'afọ 1988

A na-etinye uri ya "n'etiti nkume na ebe siri ike" n'ime ọrụ ịgba egwu Shelter nke Jawole Willa Jo Zollar, dịka Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater mere malite n'afọ 1995. Gossett nyere aka n'ụdị akụkọ ohu na-agụ egwu Andrea E
Woods Rememorabilia, Scraps From Out a Tin Can, Everybody Has Some. Ọ bụkwa onye dere akwụkwọ a na-akpọ the immigrant suite: hey xenophobe! Ònye ka ị na-akpọ onye mba ọzọ? (2007).

Ọrụ ya apụtala n'ọtụtụ akwụkwọ, gụnyere Artforum, Black Scholar, The Village Voice, Conditions, Essence, Jazz Spotlite News, Pleasure and Danger: Exploring Female Sexuality, This Bridge Called My Back, na Daughters of Africa.
